title: History Project
name: History Project
description:
A Map by Robinhood7

History Project

properties.name: Auschwitz Concentration Camp
properties.description: Posted by Robinhood7Oswiecim Poland Auschwitz concentration camp was a death camp near the small town of Oswiecim Poland. This camp was used in the nazi\'s "Final Solution" in world war two. The nazi final solution was their plan to exterminate the Jewish people. At this site alone over 2 million Jews were killed between 1940 and 1945. There was actually three Aushwitz camps, camps 1 and 2 were death camps, and the third camp was a work camp. The prisoners held here were killed the ways mainly; gas chambers, crematorium, and shot. You can still visit this site today where so many Jews and other people have lost their lives.

properties.name: Boston Harbor
properties.description: Posted by Robinhood7boston harbor massachuesetts The Boston tea party was a revolutionary act by the American colonists. The British were charging outrageous prices for their tea so the Colonist smuggled tea in from Holland. In response the this the British made a tea tax forcing the colonist to buy their tea. In rebellion to this act the colonists scemed a plan to get back at the British. On the night of December 16, 1773 three british ships came into Boston harbor to deliver a large amount of tea. A group of men called "The Sons of Liberty" dressed themselves up as mohawk indians and raided the ships. That night the group dumped over 45 tons of British tea overboard into the boston harbor.

properties.name: Globe Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Robinhood7Â London The globe theatre is one of three main theatres that William Shakespeare\'s plays were performed at in his time. In London this theatre was a main attraction of the town and surrounding cities holding up to three thousand people. The Globe Theatre was built in 1599 by a group called Lord Chaimberlin\'s Men which William Shakespeare was a active member in at the time. In a sad turn of events the the theatre was burned to the ground on June 29, 1613 and was rebuilt a year later. In 1944 the grand stadium was closed.

properties.name: Invasion of Normandy
properties.description: Posted by Robinhood7normandy beach france The invasion of the beaches of Normandy was one of the largest sea invasion of its time. It consisted of over 156,000 allied troops. The first boats landed on June 6, 1944, this day was known as D-day. The reason for entering Normandy was simple, the allied forces wanted to set up a base in Normany to supply troops with equipment and reinforcements. Fighting went on here for weeks until the allied forces finally took control of the beach and the surrounding area.

properties.name: Pearl Harbor
properties.description: Posted by Robinhood7pearl harbor hawaii Pearl Harbor was a very historical place in American history because this is where Japan attacked the U.S. tog et us into Worl War Two. On the morning of December 7, 1941 353 Japanese fighters jets and bombers flew into the Hawaiian bay. The Japanese sunk two US Navy battleships, The USS Arizona along with the USS Missouri. The foreign invaders also downed 188 American planes and other aircrafts. The human death total was about 2,388 dead and aproximately 1,178 wounded.

properties.name: Plymouth Rock
properties.description: Posted by Robinhood7plymouth rock Plymouth rock is the foundation of the United States. This is where the first Pilgrims fleeing from Holland struck land in America in 1620. They sialed in the famous ship the Mayflower and when the struck land they made the first colony, Plymouth. The leader of these voyagers was William Bradford who later was governor of the providence for over 30 years. They called it Plymouth rock cause of the huge boulder on the beach, which is still located there to this day.

properties.name: St. Augustine Florida
properties.description: Posted by Robinhood7St. Augustine Florida St. Augustine Florida is the oldest European city in the United States. Ponce de Leon first discovered America at St. Augustine in 1513. Leon on stopped for a whlie in this area, it was Juan Menendez de Aviles who made the first settlement here. Becoming a Spanish colony St. Augustine turned into a hot spot for invasions and was seemingly always under attack. The French, British, and Native Americans all wanted to control the fortress. Only the British successfully invaded the fort and they did it twice.

properties.name: Stonehedge
properties.description: Posted by Robinhood7wiltshire englandStonehedge is a series of huge boulders placed in an exact formation in Wiltshire England. No one knows why these mysterious yet beautiful formations have occured. Although the creator is not known we do know that they were arranged before history was recorded. This landmark was believed to have been made over 5,000 years ago. Since its creation there has been many changes and decomposition of Stonehedge. Many of the smaller blue stones have fallen or coroded and the carvings on the larger stones show signs of major corossion and decay.

properties.name: Virginia Tech University
properties.description: Posted by Robinhood7virginia Virginia Tech University was founded in 1872. As an acedemic ad military school it is one of the top 10 Universities in America. On April 16, 2007, the schools history cheanged forever. On this day a student attending the school shot and killed 32 students and wounded many more. The students name was Seung-Hui Choa and moments after murdering his fellow classman he took his own life. This was the deadliest and most severe school shooting in American History

properties.name: Williamsport Pennsylvania
properties.description: Posted by Robinhood7Williamsport Pennsylvania Williamsport is a very important city in America when it comes Little League Baseball. This is the town where the Little League World Series is held every August since 1947. The best teams from the eight regions of the US come to play here in an inter-national tournament. In this event there is two brackets. One is the American teams and the other is inter-nation teams from all around the world.
